performance_metrics.name: Detection Rate (False Positive Rate)
performance_metrics.description: Percentage of actual intrusion attempts that are correctly identified by the IDPS.  Lower rates are crucial for minimizing disruption and alert fatigue.

performance_metrics.name: Detection Rate (True Positive Rate)
performance_metrics.description: Percentage of actual intrusion attempts that are correctly identified by the IDPS.  High rates ensure effective threat mitigation.

performance_metrics.name: Response Time (Alert Generation)
performance_metrics.description: Time taken for the IDPS to generate an alert upon detecting a suspicious event.  Low latency is vital for rapid response.

performance_metrics.name: Response Time (Remediation)
performance_metrics.description: Time taken for the IDPS to execute a predefined remediation action (e.g., blocking an IP address, terminating a process).  This should be minimized without compromising security.

performance_metrics.name: Throughput (Network Traffic)
performance_metrics.description: The maximum data rate the IDPS can process without significant performance degradation.  This depends on network traffic characteristics and sensor density.

performance_metrics.name: CPU Utilization
performance_metrics.description: Percentage of CPU resources consumed by the IDPS. High utilization can impact system performance and availability.

performance_metrics.name: Memory Utilization
performance_metrics.description: Amount of RAM utilized by the IDPS. Optimized memory management is crucial for sustained performance.

implementation_requirements.name: Sensor Density
implementation_requirements.specification: Minimum 2 sensors per critical server rack, 1 sensor per critical network segment.
implementation_requirements.description: Adequate sensor placement is essential for comprehensive coverage and accurate detection.

implementation_requirements.name: Signature Updates
implementation_requirements.specification: Automated signature updates with a refresh frequency of at least daily, with vulnerability scan integration.
implementation_requirements.description: Regular signature updates are critical for protecting against the latest threats.

implementation_requirements.name: Rule Customization
implementation_requirements.specification: Ability to create and modify custom rules based on specific business needs and threat profiles.
implementation_requirements.description: Flexibility to adapt the IDPS to unique security requirements.

implementation_requirements.name: Log Management Integration
implementation_requirements.specification: Seamless integration with a SIEM (Security Information and Event Management) system.
implementation_requirements.description: Centralized log collection and analysis for enhanced threat visibility and incident response.

implementation_requirements.name: Redundancy and High Availability
implementation_requirements.specification: Dual-stack architecture with active/passive failover, or clustered deployment.
implementation_requirements.description: Ensures continuous operation and minimizes downtime.

implementation_requirements.name: Network Segmentation
implementation_requirements.specification: IDPS deployed within and between critical network zones.
implementation_requirements.description: Controls the spread of potential breaches.
